item.description:
Let's ride the very flat, Minuteman Rail Trail (~16 miles round trip). We'll poll the group to see if they would like to lengthen the ride, by going out to Concord.

I should add that I'll set a 10-14 MPH (moving average) pace with plenty of stopping at major points for the group to regroup. We'll try to keep this at a brisk pace, but be on the look out for kids, bladers, runners etc. and road crossings.

Please bring bike tire repair kit, energy snacks, water, camera, layers of clothing etc. A bike helmet is required.

Slick road surfaces cancel this ride.  My mobile number will be sent out on Friday night.

The high for Saturday is a sunny 49 degrees, so be advised to wear cold weather biking stuff (leggings, jacket, gloves with fingers,...)

Afterwards we will stop at _____________ (a pub) for food and drink and laughter. Please indicate if you're interested in going to the restaurant after the ride.

 

Let's meet behind the Bank of America / Not Your Average Joes parking lot near the corner of Mystic Ave and Mass Ave (RT 60 & 2A). Here is a google map link http://g.co/maps/2w7xf

I'll be wearing a bright yellow jacket and hanging out near my brown MINI cooper on the East side of the parking lot & trail.
item.how_to_find_us: East end of parking lot behind Bank of America and Not Your Average Joes.
item.name: Ride the Minute Man Rail Trail Arlington to Bedford and Beyond?
